timeline.message:
chore: minor RQTT debug improvements

Some minor tweaks that make it easier to debug RQTT failures

timeline.bodyText:
I'd argue that this should be a WARN because in normal production steady state operation this shouldn't happen, right?
If it is happening, e.g. because the consumer group is unstable, then people will likely be seeing poor pull query performance and may be wondering why.   Logging this will help highlight the cause.
During a cluster resize or bounce this can be logged, but again, if someone is investigating spikes in pull query latency, such a log message may be useful.
Thoughts? cc @AlanConfluent @vpapavas
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

replies.bodyText: Yes, I agree.  During normal operation, you wouldn't expect to see this, so warn is appropriate.
replies.author: AlanConfluent
